fields.description:
https://engage.eucalyptus.com/customer/portal/questions/793114-fast-start-eucalyptus-user-console-can-t-login

This is an example of the difficulty of diagnosing a mis-set or missing value in the config file. We can do a better job of logging the problem.
fields.summary: mis-set values in console.ini are hard to diagnose

comments.body: verify pyramid responds nicely and that we handle our own configuration values properly.

So far, I've been able to mis-set some pyramid values that we rely on and achieved some breakage. Perhaps we should examine the config that we depend on and flag errors so that errors can be more readily identified.

I think some of these values are "critical" and others, not so much (but we could check and fail to start if critical values are mis-set) ([~kgill], what do you think?) :
## Pyramid settings ##
pyramid.reload_templates = false
pyramid.debug_authorization = false
pyramid.debug_notfound = false
pyramid.debug_routematch = false
pyramid.default_locale_name = en
pyramid.includes =
    pyramid_beaker
    pyramid_chameleon
    pyramid_layout
#    pyramid_debugtoolbar

## Session config ##
# See http://beaker.readthedocs.org/en/latest/configuration.html
#
# Session type is one of cookie, file, dbm, memory, ext:memcached, ext:database, ext:google
# The 'cookie' session type has a hard limit of 4096 bytes
session.type = cookie
session.key = eucaconsole_session
session.keyini = /etc/eucaconsole/session-keys.ini
session.httponly = true
# Secure session implies SSL setup
session.secure = false
# Idle timeout (1800 sec = 30 min)
session.timeout = 1800
# Absolute timeout (43200 sec = 12 hours)
session.cookie_expires = 43200

## Cache config ##
# configuration of regions for dogpile.cache
cache.memory = dogpile.cache.pylibmc
cache.memory.url = 127.0.0.1:11211
cache.short_term.expire = 60
cache.default_term.expire = 300
cache.long_term.expire = 3600
cache.extra_long_term.expire = 43200

[~dkavanagh]: We could document which console.ini values are required or optional and what the valid choices are within the scope of GUI-1355.  We can probably close GUI-120 since Pyramid provides proper notices when the values are misconfigured or missing.

I commented out "session.type" and it messed up sessions, but I wasn't informed by pyramid. That's the kind of thing I'm talking about. It might be hard to nail down all of the possibilities, but if we can pin down things that we absolutely require to be defined and ensure they're with some reasonable bounds, that'll help in the field.
[~dkavanagh]: Could you clarify what "messed up sessions" means in this context?  How did you know the sessions were "messed up"?
It kept being asked to login.

Yes, this would be a great usability improvement.

If we could let folks know what is required, and provide good feedback when things are messed up (what specifically is messed up, what is expected) that would be really helpful to folks setting up the console.
easy recovery from errors is one of the main tentpoles of good UX and something Euca needs to improve on

Here's a list of configuration parameters I would consider important to be set to the default values we specify in the default console.ini:
 - use
 - pyramid.includes
 - session.type
 - cache.memory

For these, I propose logging a clear error message and halting the application.

It seems like the rest of the values could be modified for good reasons. I wonder if in some cases, we might want to do some additional checks, such bounds checking certain timeouts? Perhaps we could log warnings in some cases, but allow the application to run anyway? We'll have to explore this scenario a bit more.
If you alter the values in console.ini mentioned in the comment above the PR, you should see an error presented in the log when you try running the console.
UX review passed, ready for code review.
Punting back to [~dkavanagh] to implement refactoring suggested in PR comments.  i.e. moved config check to a dedicated check_config() function, similar to the check_types() function.

This is not working for "use = egg:eucaconsole".  I tried commenting that out or changing it to an invalid value and did not receive an error message.  The eucaconsole failed to start but no error about the invalid or missing value.

Log entries during failures:
{code}
2014-12-02 13:52:41 INFO Handling signal: term
2014-12-02 13:52:42 INFO Worker exiting (pid: 3948)
2014-12-02 13:52:42 INFO Worker exiting (pid: 3949)
2014-12-02 13:52:42 INFO Worker exiting (pid: 3950)
2014-12-02 13:52:42 INFO Worker exiting (pid: 3951)
2014-12-02 13:52:42 INFO Shutting down: Master
{code}

Version:
{code}
[root@h-07 ~]# rpm -qi eucaconsole
Name        : eucaconsole                  Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.1.0                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.4856.252.20141202git612524d.el6   Build Date: Tue 02 Dec 2014 09:56:20 AM PST
Install Date: Tue 02 Dec 2014 11:32:33 AM PST      Build Host: ip-172-16-20-231
Group       : Unspecified                   Source RPM: eucaconsole-4.1.0-0.0.4856.252.20141202git612524d.el6.src.rpm
Size        : 10496213                         License: BSD and MIT and OFL
Signature   : (none)
{code}

We cannot do anything with egg::eucaconsole. it isn't even visible to our application. Sorry!
If the rest works, let's just move this through. I looked at the use value specifically and found it was stripped from our settings the app sees.
The other logs work for the other console.ini values.  Verified fix.
